title: Restart image asset loading from scratch and make success image render reliably

requirements.text: Make the success/result view reliably display the image asset even when the filename contains spaces by updating the src to use a URL-encoded path for the exact case-sensitive filename "Kanni 14.PNG" under "/assets/generated/".
acceptanceCriteria: After clicking “Yes”, the success screen requests the image via a URL-encoded path (space encoded as %20) while still referencing the exact filename "Kanni 14.PNG" (case-sensitive).
In Chrome and Safari (desktop and mobile), the image renders on the success screen without requiring any manual refresh.

requirements.text: Add explicit runtime error handling for the success/result image so that if the image fails to load, the UI shows a clear English fallback message and preserves the rest of the success layout.
acceptanceCriteria: If the image fails to load (e.g., 404), the user sees an English message indicating the image could not be loaded (without breaking the page layout).
If the image loads successfully, no fallback message is shown.

requirements.text: Ensure the frontend static assets include the success image file in the deployable public directory at the exact path "frontend/public/assets/generated/Kanni 14.PNG" (capital K, space, .PNG extension), and remove/avoid any references on the success screen to other similarly-named files (e.g., "kanni 14.PNG", "kanni 14-1.PNG", "kanni 14-2.PNG").
acceptanceCriteria: The repository contains the file at "frontend/public/assets/generated/Kanni 14.PNG" exactly (including capitalization and spacing).
The success/result view references only "/assets/generated/Kanni 14.PNG" (URL-encoded as needed) and does not reference any other success image filenames anywhere in the rendered success flow.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.

Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or any files under frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not introduce additional backend services or databases; keep the backend as a single Motoko actor (no new backend required for this fix).
Keep static image serving purely via frontend public assets; do not serve images from the backend.
nonGoals: Fixing or diagnosing Caffeine platform internal configuration/deployment errors (outside the application code).
Adding new features beyond ensuring the existing success image displays reliably.
